ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Time Point
Trial type
Hour of the day of the sample
Mean X axis acceleration of the band in G forces
Mean Y axis acceleration of the band in G forces
Mean Z axis acceleration of the band in G forces
Mean root mean square acceleration across al three axes in G forces using: sqrt(X^2+Y^2+Z^2)
Binary variable indicating if the band is in motion based on acceleration occuring only in one axis
Mean X axis accelerationin m/s^2
Mean Y axis acceleration in m/s^2
Mean Z axis acceleration in m/s^2
Mean root mean square acceleration across al three axes in m/s^2 using: sqrt(X^2+Y^2+Z^2)
Standard deviation of X axis acceleration of the band in G forces
Standard deviation of Y axis acceleration of the band in G forces
Standard deviation of Z axis acceleration of the band in G forces
Standard deviation of root mean square acceleration across al three axes in G forces using: sqrt(X^2+Y^2+Z^2)
Task mean level (SCL) in microsiemens
Standard deviation of electrodermal activity in microsiemens
Mean of all temperatures recorded (sum of all temperatures at recording rate / epoch output rate)
Binary variable indicating if the band is worn based on physiological values outside of physical possibility
